abstracts.cdata!:
The Second and Third Development Finance
            Company Projects in Liberia was implemented. Both the Second
            and the Third Projects were approved against the background
            of two decades of impressive growth of the economy,
            impressive operational and financial performance of the
            Liberia Bank for Development and Investment (LBDI), and
            government policies favoring private foreign and domestic
            investments. During implementation the environment changed
            drastically with adverse impact on the financial condition
            and performance of LBDI as well as its clients. The unstable
            economic conditions and political changes during the period
            of project implementation, resulted in a number of
            businesses being closed or changing ownership. These overall
            economic factors reduced the development impact of the
            projects in relation to what would have been in normal
            economic conditions. The medium- to long-term funds provided
            under the projects, together with other foreign lines of
            credit to LBDI, represented virtually the only term
            resources available in the country for the private sector.
            The role the projects played in the economy was, therefore, substantial.
